scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters, 1855-56, to publishers Dix and Edwards, that discuss the publication and format of Oriental Acquaintanceand send a receipt for "Experiences in Mount Lebanon." A letter, 1876, to Mrs. [Johnson T.?] Platt doubts that Frances Burney was only sixteen when she wrote Evelinaand gives his opinion on the intellectual maturation of women novelists.
One of DeForest's calling cards is included.

did.unittitle: John William DeForest to Dix and Edwards 1855 Oct 4

scopecontent.p: Sends payment receipt for "Experiences in Mount Lebanon" published in Putnam's Monthly.

did.unittitle: J. W. DeF. to D. and E. 1856 Feb 16

scopecontent.p: Requests slight postponement of publication of his Oriental Acquaintancefor several additions and polishing. Mentions postponement of European trip.

did.unittitle: J. W. DeF to D. and E. 1856 Feb 26

scopecontent.p: Agrees to make his Oriental Acquaintancechanges in proof and meet original publication date. Discusses his chapter format.

did.unittitle: J. W. DeF to D. and E. 1859 May 29

scopecontent.p: More on proofs and chapter numbering for Oriental Acquaintance.

did.unittitle: J. W. DeF. to Mrs. [Johnson T. ?] Platt 1876 Feb 16

scopecontent.p: Discusses the age of "the author of Evelina" Frances Burney, which he feels was not 16 but 24 when it was published. Expresses his opinions on women novelists and their maturing intellectually "towards 30."
